title: Rek'Sai Warrior (item) will be back?
body:
From Patchnotes 6.18:

>When Rek’Sai was released, we positioned her as a member of the Fighter class: a durable, damage-focused melee champion that wants to hunt down prey and finish it off herself. In the months following release, however, our balance work on Rek’Sai de-emphasized her damage threat in favor of her team utility strengths. Her optimal playstyle settled into the Vanguard (offensive tank) space, and that identity mismatch has caused a lot of player frustration. So, when Rek’Sai’s competitive dominance put her on the balance radar, we resolved not to make the same mistake twice.

>Overall, fixing Rek’Sai’s role requires more than being cognizant of where to cut power, and we won’t promise that this’ll be the last time Rek’Sai visits the patch notes. That said, pushing her back toward kill-or-be-killed skirmishes is the first step in the process

Does it mean that Riot want to bring back old Warrior (instead of Cinderhulk) Rek'Sai and nerf her Full Tank build?

replies.body: We're planning on doing some work on Rek'Sai to shift her back towards a more damage focused champ. That'll likely involve transferring utility or tank power into damage, or at least pushing her towards more damage focused itemization. Details on that haven't been figured out yet. We wanted to mention it at this point since we've nerfed Rek'Sai a number of times recently but in not ways that have indicated that's our direction however (shorter term changes basically, working within her current state more than pushing her towards what we think she should be).
So, pushing her from a Vanguard tank to more of a Diver? Maybe Top lane Rek'sai will come back.
Yeah, diver's should be the better fit. Some CC, but less focus on team initiation power and more on personally killing stuff.

All I can say to that is thank you. I've been playing Rek'Sai since her release, and while I'm not opposed to playing 'Vanguard'ish champions, it is not satisfying when your champ's kit (her Q/E especially) is clearly oriented towards dealing damage, but deals such a low amount of it that the only thing you can do that feels like it brings value to a teamfight is mashing W to go up and down over and over to pop people into the air because the rest of your skills feel meaningless.

> Yeah, diver's should be the better fit. Some CC, but less focus on team initiation power and more on personally killing stuff.

Diver will be a hard fit on Rek.

A diver is defined by the ability to jump in but they can't jump out.  Unless all of Rek's burrows have been smooshed, she can often get back out pretty easily.

Diver is actually how Rek'Sai was sold when she was first revealed. The idea was that you wanted to bait the enemy team into a fight in an area where Rek'Sai already had plenty of tunnels set up, giving her ridiculous mobility to move in and out and around the fight to get to the target she wants to dive. At least, that was the idea on paper. In practice of course, everyone who's played her knows it doesn't really work that way.

Always thought of rek sai as being a skirmisher rather than a diver. when i think diver i think attrox, xin, irelia and kled; people that jump on their enemies and go ham on them with autos until the fight is over. Rek sai with her tunnels and knock up has way more maneuverability around a fight than a diver would IMO. In my opinion she better fits characters like vi, jarvan and wukong who are great engagers and damage dealers but build damage and die rather quickly if engaging first on a 5v5 (well jarvan sometimes doesn't if he builds tank but thats lcs shenanigans)
Aatrox is a skirmisher/diver, same for Irelia. Vi and J4 are real tanky divers like Rek'sai. Full Skirmishers are the likes of Yi.

Guess everyone has their way of categorizing. But IMO vi/renekton/jarvan/wukong/rek sai have an enough distinct gameplay pattern that they can be considered something else

bruiser: vi/renekton/jarvan/wukong/rek sai/ riven (she is a bruiser/skirmisher hibrid I think). good mobility with focus in both autos and spells. They are good engagers if built tanky but can output serious damage.
skirmisher: yi/trynda/ekko/fiora/yasuo. people  whose main source of damage is auto attacks but can easilly go in and out of a fight
Diver: xin zao/irelia/ kled/ diana/jax/nocturne/aatrox people who go in and fight until they win or the enemy gets away. they themselves have no great means to disengage from a fight and a significant portion of their damage comes from auto attacks

All these wonderfull champs belong to the fighter family, which juggernauts also kind of form part of as a fighter/ tank hybrid
Thank you!  That is how I want to play Rek'sai!

i think what doomed her. or at least. what made her. so good at pro play. is that. she has such roaming potential. without even considering her ult. and she has her ult on top of that. if her ult wasn't part of her kit. she'd be a lot easier to balance.

making it semi global might work.

her ult requires set up. Making the tunnels not last as long solves the issue in the way you are describing without making the ult akward to use (having a set up constraint on top of a distance constraint makes it basically a discount tf ult)

So do you want to make her like an assasin? Because pushing her towards damage, would be like a Kha'zix/Rengar/Yi kinda like. And all of these guys work like assasins. 

I am a Reksai one-trick, and I love her damage, and tankiness. I personally believe that the vanguard class best suits her. She's a Bruiser who can be kited to death if one is able to juke her tunnel. But if she gets on top of you, you will receive a lot of damage, and may be killed if she has enough tools. I have never seen her as an assasin, or a full damage build. I am perfectly fine with the damage nerfs she has received, but I have hated the overall changes to other parts of her kit. She doesn't feel Rek'sai at all after her Tremor Sense changes, because she isn't able to locate her prey exactly. Anyhow, I love how Reksai is up until now, and I wouldn't want to see her nerfed to the ground like Elise was at a time, or Kindred currently is, or Lee was at another time.

they want to make her function like vi, jarvan and wukong, which is not a bad thing. You can solve the kiting issue by buying gauntlet/ blue smite/ randuins/black cleaver. She is not supposed to be a champ that chases people anyhow, she needs follow up for her team or be ahead to get kills

OK, awesome. I don't feel nearly as bad about these repeated nerfs if you guys really do have a plan of attack to rebalance her power. I am tired of her crowding out competitive picks in the LCS along with Gragas. A more damage-oriented kit was what I thought she was supposed to be before she became nothing more than a glorified vision/knock-up bot.
Thx for answer! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

She's grown pretty miserable due to consequent nerfs patch after patch, so this is really good news to me. I believe she used to be one of the best candidates for The Black Cleaver, since her Q is a wonder to combine with the Cleaver's effects. 20% also meant she could use her spells more often and provide more knock-ups, but in time, with Cleaver shifting to more AD over HP and her consequent nerfs, the build became pretty obscene. I hope you guys find a direction that suit hers well as a middle-of-the-fight berserker.

Personally, I would like to see more of her rage mechanic in effect. She's designed to sustain off her rage, and empowers her E with it. But that's completely overshadowed when you build her tank. 

Reduce her defenses, but increase her sustain. Should allow her to clear well without becoming too hard to kill. And perhaps give her rage mechanic stronger scaling with offensive itemization.

****
                       ACTUAL CHANGES listed bellow, in case my rant is too tideous to read {{champion:421}} {{item:3070}} 

****

So I was planning to make an entire post about it myself but since you have commented here at that increases the chances of Riot seeing my cries of anguish I'll post it here. I am a one trick rek sai on LAN (same summoner name) and having played a ton of games with her (with a win rate that picked at 70% and a performance 40% above average) and climbed all the way to plat 2, until you guy's decided to nerf her her radar and messed my mojo, I think I could present some valuable insight on what she is supposed to become going forward. 

First of, I totally get that you gutted her early game so that worlds would have some diversity. By reading the patch notes I get the sense that you are trying to communicate : "yeah we are aweare we totally messed her up but in the commming futures after worlds balance is no longer at risk we will define her identity as a fighter and move her away from tanky builds". At first I was really worried that rek sai would recieve the poppy treatment and not be buffed until eaons later as an after thought, but this makes me hopeful that you guys are invested in balancing and defining her role as a bruiser.

So with that out of the way, I'd like to start by giving my 2 cents on what Rek Sai's core strenghts and weaknesses are. She is a melee bruiser that excels and farming, counter jungling (through tracking and mobility)  and getting ahead in gold so that she is stronght mid game and can fight, splitpush and do other fun shennanigans.

To do this, she should rely on being more damage oriented than she currently is (having to buy 2 or even 3 damage items would be ideal), should not have so much early pressure ganking wise, and should need to get gold through clever jungling to stay ahead and THEN become a threat to other players. In short, she should not be as tanky and shoulld rely in items to stay relevant.

Now this are just some adjustments I would recommend in order to accomplish the vision of what I understand rek sai to be, and of course without actual play test I don't now if they are great or not, but after player her as much as I do I think I have a good sense of what should be done.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
****
CHANGES (just brain storming, not saying all the changes have to be implemented in orther to fix rek sai


Passive:
This is the most effy of all my proposed changes, since it would probably require art resources to be aloccated to the change and I'm not sure how flexible your teams are since I believe now they are standardized by teams. However I don't think the resources  used would be that hefty and it might be possible to use them.

Make rek sais delay between sonar "ticks" be longer as the target moves away from rek sai, having a fix tick rate of .75 secs up until 200 untils and then start delaying it until about 1.25 secs. This behaviour would be comunicated in game by having an expansive soundwave (same color as texture as the sonar circles) that would move at the necesary speed to indicate when rek sai "sees things"; the sound wave deaccelerates over time. Also the sound wave would be visible to allies, and enemies when they have vision of rek sai. Also not sure how to make the wave not clutter the map... wmaybe it could work better if only rek sai saw the sound wave but enemies could see the circles they are making when rek sai is visible

Q:

Make it have have less  base damage, do increased damage to jungle monsters and scale slightly better. This makes rek sai great at farming, insentivises damage builds at caps her early ganking/ dueling pressure

W:

Not sure how good this would be for clarity purposes but maybe have knock up hight on enemy chanmpions increase by rank level? The idea here is to make rek sai's early ganks less viable, although the Q change might suffice for that. I'm not super confident about this change but have nothing to lose by posting it, it might work

E: (Important one!)

Make rek sai's tunnels go from 22 to 18 seconds, but drastically reduce the amount of time a tunnel is up (10 minutes is super forgiving!). Without play testing I can't say for certain how long they should last (thinking for about 2 mins maybe?). The idea is that if rek sai is counter jungled and her tunnels destroyed or she doessn't use her tunnels efficiently for farming early game then after, say 2 mins later, they will start collapsing and reduce her farming speed quite drastically.

Also her bite doing true damage is one of the reasons tank rek sai works. If rek sai builds tank, then she can always wait for her rage meter to fill up and then do insane damage. Instead, her bite should have bonus flat armor pen when her rage bar fills up. Also possibly for this to work the base damage of the skill should be lowered and the scaling increased.

R: 

to me this ability is ok at present, the cd was too forgiving before but now it is acceptable

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Some other stat changes to accomany these would be necessary of course, but my main concern is her having so little armor early game, which will impact her first clear in a really bad way
Friendly reminder that Reksai is pretty much p/b status ever since she got introduced to the lcs which is almost 2 years ago

But i think if Riot nerfed Tank Rek Sai and buff fighter Rek'Sai + nerf her utility (e.g. revert change to her W that if u max it she can knock up enemies a bit faster after knocking them up earlier) it should be healthy for game (because if she built offensive items, she wouldn't be so tanky) and especially for LCS, where warrior on Rek'Sai isn't as viable as Cinderhulk.
Honestly, Warrior is still garbage compared to the other enchantments.
Why no talk on Kalista? Why are certain champions spoken about when others are not?
We've got a direction in mind for Rek'Sai, so we mentioned it. With Kalista we're still talking about both the issues different people do/don't see with her kit and what the appropriate direction is.
how likely is she to get a rework?
What about Azir? Doesn't he have similar issues to Kalista?
:O that's awesome meddler! Kalista is a very fun but very constrained champion... do you see her having a standalone ult instead of being hand tied to Bard while he hunts for chimes? :(

Consider making her identity all about shadowbinding with her Allies instead of a hoppy spear chucker.

P: Cursed Banshee: Kallista has been slain by the Ruined King. Instead of her old body, her cursed soul roams freely seeking revenge, and ignoring all terrain. While she is in her spectral form, she can only be hurt by magic damage but she cannot auto attack. Gain 100% bonus movement speed.

Q: Spectral Spear  10 second cooldown (line skill shot) 
Shoot a spectral spear which marks all targets hit and does light damage. Allies can trigger the mark to slow the target for 1 second.

W: Possess Ally: Possess target allied champion or minion for 5/6/7/8/9 seconds. 
Passive: The target gains a shield equal to 10% of your hitpoints for the duration. 
Active: Consume the shield to give ally 30% movement speed for 3 seconds. (20 second cooldown).

E: Fate's Call (Only usable while possessing an allied champion): Leave allied champion's body and revert to spectral form. Ally can choose a short area to dash to. 

R:  Wail of the Cursed Siren: Kallista channels her rage for 3 seconds in the form of a loud SCREAM. After the channel, all enemies are GLOBALLY STUNNED for 1.5 seconds. 

(The cry of the banshee/siren was the last sound people heard before their death. This is a variation of the global Karthus Ultimate. Having a cool Ultimate like this is important for every champion. A lot of champions dont have cool ultimates that fully embrace the champion's thematic/strategic identity. A good example is Bard, a bad example is Trundle's)

She will have a cool niche as a spectral support, empowering her allies by possessing them and providing a lot of vision in the form of her passive which allows her to cross terrain freely. Its balanced by the fact that she has no damage in this "scouting" form but she can still be hit by all magic spells. The 100% movement speed allows her to roam quick and possibly splitpush by possessing minions.

Solo Lane Kalista may be possible by possessing minions or the jungler, but her niche will be in duo lanes.

She is a different type of support because she can buff an ALLY from the inside, but effectively losing a body during a teamfight. (Think Abathur crossed with Leoric). Sort of a spectral support who uses her anger and deadly voice to bring justice to the dead. 

I know this departs from the ADC Kalista you released, but I think it would suit her thematics to continue her vengence even after losing her physical body. She retains elements of her Q , oathsworn, scouting/vision and elements of her R. 
Now shes even cooler because she has a sick BANSHEE ULTIMATE. 

I think making her a spectral banshee and fully embracing her vengence is an awesome way to go... compared to trying to make her a spear chucking ADC. Just my two cents, but she would be better as a ghost/spirit/ siren

I think riot has gone quiet with her because she has such clashing themes going on with her. She was designed as the tutorial adc for newbs that would teach them to kite and play with their supports, but she has a high lerning curve. Also half of her kit makes her great for being a solo carry and halfs works best when with her bonded team mate. I suspects those clashes make riot undecisive on how to approach fixing her. Rek sai on the other hand has a clear defined identity that drifted away but can probably be fixed with some number changes
In my case, fighter build reksai was always the proper way in soloQ

I wonder if Riot has finally nerfed her to the point that she is not played anymore. This is not a small nerf. This drastically changes her survivability, especially at early levels. Translation: "We've seen too much Rek'sai in the LCS. We're going to break her until we feel like revisiting the issue."

God damnit. I have no more reason to play one of my favorite champions without being a significant risk to my team.

Wrong they knew they could take that much "Power" from her and she would still be pick ban. Due to flash knock up...

With gragas E and Reksai Q they could do Zero Damage and just provide their knockups/backs/displacements and still be P/B every game in LCS.
I'll be happy as long as they won't leave her like as it is now. She has to find a place.
